jutils

Class DebugStatus

  • java.lang.Object
    • jutils.DebugStatus
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Trace

    public class DebugStatus
extends java.lang.Object
    The DbgStatis class maintains the state of the debug params that will be used when creating other classes. This is done centrally so we can set the debug status of a class, before it has been created, or even if we it is defined in in some other class. Once the class is created, it's debug status may be maintained by calls to this class. This process allows programs to set and un-set the debug flags for classes dynamically during runtime. While not actually having access to classes.

    • Method Detail

      • debugParams

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> debugParams()
        returns a Set of Strings of the Known debug params. Note that a debug Param can bed defined in the list, but not in the actual DebugFlags if the info is not in the Debug.ini file.
        Returns:
        Set of Strings of known debug params

      • getDF

        public boolean getDF(java.lang.String classCode)
        Get the debug flag value for the given Class.
        NOTE: If the DB_ALL flag is set, this always returns true, otherwise the actual debugFlag for the passed classCode is returned. Use this for checking if Debugging should be performed.
        Parameters:
        classCode - String value of the Class Code
        Returns:
        boolean value of the debug flag for the class or false if not defined

      • getClassDF

        public boolean getClassDF(java.lang.String classCode)
        Get the debug flag value for the given Class
        NOTE: This returns the debugFlag for a specific classCode, regardless of the DebugALL setting. Use this for Menus or other debugging messages.
        Parameters:
        classCode - String value of the Class Code
        Returns:
        boolean value of the debug flag for the class or false if not defined

        public java.lang.String getField(java.lang.String classCode,

        Gets the one of the Fields for the given
        Parameters:
        classCode - String value of the code
        fldName - String value of one of the predefined fields
        Returns:
        String value of the value for the field, or null if classCode has not been defined, or fldName is invalid

      • defineFlag

        public void defineFlag(java.lang.String iCode,
                       java.lang.String iMGroup,
                       java.lang.String iClassName,
                       java.lang.String iDisplay,
                       boolean val)
        Creates a Debug Flag entry based on passed in values, normally called only by getDebugFlags, this is public to allow individual classes to "self-define" needed.
        Parameters:
        iCode - String value, unique code
        iMGroup - String value of the Menu group (if any)
        iClassName - String value of the class name
        iDisplay - String value of the display name to the debugger, or on a menu
        val - boolean value of the initial value of the debug flag

        Parameters:

        fldName - String value of one of the predefined fields
        val - String value of the value to be set
        Returns:
        boolean value indicating success of failure of the

      • setDF

        public void setDF(java.lang.String classCode,
                  boolean val)
        Set the debug flag value for the given Class.

        NOTE: If the classCode is "DB_CLEAR" then the debug Flags for all Defined classes are set to false, regardless of the value passed in val.

        Parameters:
        classCode - String value of the code
        val - boolean value of the value to be set

      • getDebugFlags

        public void getDebugFlags(java.lang.String dbFile,
                          boolean show)
        Opens the debug.ini file, if exists, and extracts the records from it that define each of the routines that will be debugged. If the file does not exist, nothing is set. Each entry of the file consists of tab delimited fields with the fields in the following order:
        • Class Code is the code for the class as defined in DebugInfo.java
        • Class Name is the class Name
        • Display Name is the name to be displayed in error messages and menus
        • Value is a string equal to "true" or "on" to indicate that debugging is "on" for this class; any other value indicates that debugging is "off" for this class. (Normal values would be "false" or "off")

        Records that begin with "*" are considered comments and are ignored

        Parameters:
        dbFile - String value of the program specific DebugIni file, if null, empty, or blank, will default to debug.ini
        show - boolean value indicating if we should show the list of the current "known" params

      • addKnown

        public boolean addKnown(java.lang.String paramCode,
                        java.lang.String pName)
        Adds a single param to the list of known debug params
        Parameters:
        paramCode - string value of the "known" debug param
        pName - string value of the package the known class is part of
        Returns:
        boolean value indicating the success of the add, returns false if the param was already "known"

      • addKnown

        public boolean addKnown(java.util.List<java.lang.String> paramCodes,
                        java.lang.String pName)
        Adds a list of params to the list of known debug params
        Parameters:
        paramCodes - List of Strings of param params to be "known"
        pName - string value of the package the known classes are part of
        Returns:
        boolean value indicating the success of the adds, returns false if any of params were already "known"

      • showFlags

        public void showFlags()
        Displays the defined Debug Flags on the Trace file in the order defined known Debug Flags. If a Debug Flag is "known", but not defined, it is not printed. Menu Group is NOT displayed.

      • getVersion

        public static java.lang.String getVersion()
        Returns the version number of this class.
        Returns:
        string value of version number

      • getAllVersions

        public static java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getAllVersions(java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> vlist)
        Returns list of mapped pairs of class file names and the version number. It also adds all called routines to the list. If the class file name and version is already in the list, it does not add them, it simply returns.
        Parameters:
        vlist - Map of the current class/versions to be appended to
        Returns:
        Map of the class/version values for this and all called routines
